Description: Fourteen gold pendants in the form of flies; the head and neck have horizontal ribbed decoration; each is pierced with two holes on either side of the head for stringing; a tiny hole in the back of each.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Curator's comments: The pendants may represent or echo the symbolism of the fly in Egyptian New Kingdom cultures. Fly pendants and ornaments were awarded On the significance of fly symbolism in ancient Egypt, see Gestoso Singer 2009. Bibliography: Gestoso Singer, G.N. 2009. 'Queen Ahhotep and the "Golden Fly". Cahiers Caribéens d'Egyptologie 12 (Feb.-March 2009).
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (663)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (P43, Pl VIII)
